author: Blade
title: A reminder of the good old days...
review:
I picked this one to be my first of the six to buy as from the packet looked the wickedest and my girlfriend could relate to it. (looks like some creature from Harry Potter i think)It really re minds me of the old school enemy's of the toa. i unfortunately have missed allot of story line due to my absence from this hobby but if its a mutation of something its not bad.

Compared to older sets the skeletal structure looks very week except for the head and hands. the back spikes are cool, but from the front appear to be not even dangerous. Also i would like to point out for a set new out of the box the joints are very flimsy in the legs. weather this is due to too much top end weight or what i dont know but i have seen allot tighter.

The squid gun is lame a good concept but needs so much more work i intend to read up on how to actually fire this properly as on the model or in my hand it sucked. 

The claws, well personally the almost make up for the gun. the look dangerous and deadly. Also love the face looks realistic.

Overall I give this an 7/10 There have been better but have been worse. A nice addition to the set if you like em.

Oh and I dont know if it was meant to glow but i should have done, would have complemented the model nicely.

author: DarkLordMakuta
title: Ehlek
review: Ehlek is cool as heck! Just about everything about him is cool, the spines, the claws, and the head. I modified his launcher hand a bit, because I still hate the squid launchers, so he's symmetrical now. The only thing I don't like is the fact that the lime green sockets break WAY too easily. Other than that, he's one of the best Barraki available.

author: Aleiobot
title: Cool but a few cons
review:
Now I must say this is a cool Barraki set! I currently broke a part to it but hopefully I'll get a replacement :)

Pros:
Cool mask
Cool spine
Cool claws.

Cons:
Squid launcher does not work well
He is hard to stand up

Now this is just my opinion so you get it if you want, this thing is still cool!

author: reidak49
title: somewhat good
review: i dont relly like the barrki there sqiud launchers dont fire i wish the used zamors again but the barraki look differnt from each other and they look ugly but the color is nice and the claws stink ands there needs to be some bulk

author: Pepper
title: hmm, I changed my mind Ehlek is my 3rd favorite Barraki
review:
I got Ehlek for my birthday last year along with Mantax, Takadox, and Kalmah. Well on to the pros. and cons..

Pros.
very cool head and spines
squid launcher
squid
lime green pieces are a cool color

Cons.
squid do not stay in holders
one of the pieces broke

Overall you should buy him before he's gone

author: Gus_263
title: One of the most cool Barraki
review: Ehlek is really a great barraki. He is so simple, but his design, color and weapons are awesome. Another fact that do Ehlek be who he is is his incredible spine. But he have also some serious problems, like the problems on shoot the squid and the most terrible, his so easy to broken lime green pieces, great enemies to do a creation. Only by that i rate Ehlek 4/5

author: Tb96
title: What is this!?!?!?
review:

2/5 Tb96

author: whiffy5
title: Ehlek
review:
It is such a good set, though the squid lancher dosen't work very well, but he
looks very cool when you take off the squid lancher. He is one of the best
Barraki ever made, but the other bionicles are cool too.

author: SaintElsewhere
title: BRILLIANT
review: Ehlek is a very cool evil character to have in one's colllection. He has the air of a great villian with his spines and mandibles and claws. The Barraki are some of the coolest villians next to the Rakshi (am I spelling that right?) and the Makuta from this year's Phantoka/Mistika line.

author: legoguy_3000_
title: Rubbery spines
review:
A very good set but the squid launcher is just a big piece of rubber, and the same with the squid. 

Pros:
Mandables
Claws

cons:
Squid launcher doesn't fire
Rubbery spines

I think this set is a bit disappointing, with the squid launcher 3/5

you can combine it with Mantax and Carpar to make Pit War Tortoise. If you want to get Pit War Tortoise I'll just do a tiny review of him:

Pit War Tortoise isn't a very good combo.

Pros:
cool teeth
mandables

Cons:
Bad colour scheme
lower limbs sections twist
rubbery spines

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Love this set, but... the joints break
review:
Ehlek was my first Barraki, and is definitely my favorite.  I love his spines and protosteel claws.  I always like his chomping mandibles.  My only complaints are that his joints break :(.  I was able to get replacement pieces in an order for identical pieces for Toa Mahri Hahli.  So, let's see the stats.

Pros:

Spines

Claws

Chomping Mandibles

Cons:

Ball joints break

Squids wear down

Squids flip head over tail when you shoot them

Thanks for reading this review!

author: kibble123456789
title: best barraki ever!
review:
Not that i have every Barraki but i have 3 and Ehlek is my favorite!  He has awesome spikes which resemble a porcupine and is bent down which is pretty creepy.  The squid shooter is horrible!  But his head is one of the coolest ever!  If you do have or are going to have him replace the squid launcher with his other claw identical to the other arm.  Here are the pros and cons.

pros 
awesome claws 
awesome head/pinchers 
purcupine like spikes
nice body potion 
cool feet 
new parts (at the time)

cons 
feet can come off kinda easily 
spikes come off allot 
squid launcher is the worst launchr ever

author: Alemas
title: One of the hands broke...
review:
Yep, another problem for the lime green hand pieces! Even though we repaired it, I never played with it again, fearing it may break again!

Pros:

Spikes
Evil-looking

Cons:

Fragile hands that break
Squid launcher

Overall, a fragile set.

author: Carl
title: EHLEK-TRIC! (excuse the pun)
review:
Ehlek is the best of the Barraki. He has a unique build, sort of similair to Takadox, and has electric spines on his back. Awesome!

Pros:
- Head is great for MOCing
- Claws
- Electric spines
- Piraka feet
- Mandibles
- Unique build
- Nice choice of limbs
- Little armour makes him look agile

Cons:
- Squid launcher (MAJOR CON!)

Although the squid launcher is really bad and I said that it was a major con you can just take it off and adjust the squid-launcher-holding-claw slightly so he just has two claws.

Right now Ehlek is holding up Toa Mahri Nuparu and giving him some good old EHLEK-TRIC shocks!

author: drosteScincid
title: One of the Best Bionicle Sets
review:
Ehlek is not only the best-looking Barraki, but, as the title says, one of the best Bionicle sets ever. I also like the underwater theme.
His body doesn't use the normal Inika build, instead utilizing a bent liftarm piece and two Vahki waist pieces, to which the spines are attached. It's nice to see something new. Ehlek's limbs don't have any armor, but that works to his advantage, as it gives him a cool skinny look.
He has pieces that are great for MOCing, like the the dark green Toa Metru legs, the talons and the spines.
He looks better without the squid launcher on, and you can also modify his left hand so that the talons are attached like on the right hand.
If you like Bionicle, I recommend you buy Ehlek if you can find him.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Barraki) - Ehlek Review
review:
This is a nice figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 24 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has some really cool parts which are always great to have for future MOC's (My Own Creations) and/or brickfilms for sure. We also get 3 cool spike pieces which we've also seen on Gadunka.

The build

The build is very fun and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers as well.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8920-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the legs, the feet, the hands and the head can be moved. On both hands we can see some really nice claws and on one hand we can also find a launcher which doesn't work very well. But I still love the design on Ehlek. This is also my 6th and last barraki which I had to get to complete my barraki collection.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: PaulTR
title: An Essential Barraki!
review:
I bought Ehlek (along with Carapar) during a "2-for-the-price-of-1" deal on Amazon. I was hoping Ehlek would be a good set. Instead, what I got was an amazing set!

 

First off, Ehlek is a very cool looking guy. With his Protosteel claws, green coloring, and electric spikes, Ehlek (in my humble opinion) is one of the better looking Barraki. I really like the sort of "spindly" look the designers gave him, as it makes him look like a dangerous, slippery eel. His claws fit perfectly in with his look, and his back spines are fantastic; they are probably the best-looking part of him. My only complaint with Ehlek is his lack of armor: he doesn't have a single piece of protection anywhere, besides his back spikes. However, I don't think this is a major issue, because the lack of armor gives him a sleeker, more organic look. However, I think it would have been nice if at least a few pieces of unique armor had been thrown in. All in all, Ehlek looks great, and is probably one of the best looking Barraki, along with Carapar, Takadox, and Mantax.

 

Ehlek was a fun and unique build. His entire body is composed of a bent green piece attached to 2 torso pieces, each one making up his torso and shoulders. His 3 spines are attached to these 2 pieces, and are bent in a nice shape to give Ehlek a back. I really liked Ehlek's build, and it is probably one of the more unique builds of the Barraki line up. Surprisingly for a Barraki, Ehlek's included pieces are not all that great: the only truly individualized pieces are his spikes, head, and claws. This is because he has no new armor pieces like Mantax or Kalmah (Kalmah alone has SIX unique armor pieces.) Also, while his light green pieces look fabulous, there are reports that they break. I haven't had any problems so far (I have owned Ehlek for years and play with him regularly) but its something to keep in mind. So, hats off to Ehlek's build, but the included pieces, while great for MOCers, are not as cool as some other Barraki :(

 

Ehlek is really fun to play with. You can click his jaws, make him swipe his claws (*thunk* "Whoops! Sorry Matoran!") and (try to) shoot his squid launcher. A cool thing Ehlek can do is use his claws as feet, making him crawl on all fours. As for the squid launcher, its horrible. However, I like the concept, and if LEGO had done a little more planning, I think it would have been a great launcher. Whatever the case, Ehlek (like Takadox and Pridak) looks better without it on. Another downside is Ehlek has no "action" features. Boo. But as for poseability, Ehlek is amazing. You can make him pose in all sorts of great shapes, and he looks really sinister next to his fellow Barraki, especially Carapar. Now, as for the $9.99 US dollar price tag, I think Ehlek is well-priced. Yes, the Piraka had glow in the dark skulls, laser eyes, Zamor launchers, ect, and cost only $8.99 US dollars. However, they were all pretty much built in the same way and lacked starkly different personalities (In the Bionicle universe, they had one mood: angry). Yes, I'm sad they hiked the price, but I think the design differences the Barraki have from each other really pays off. After all, Bionicle is not how many many features you can jam in a set; its about how cleverly the sets are designed, built, and look. Well, I've said my peace! Lets hit the list!

 

Pros:

  • -One of the best looking Barraki
  • -Fun and unique build
  • -Great weapons and spines
  • -Sturdy and fun to play with
  • -Poseable

Cons:

  • -Not many new pieces
  • -Lack of armor
  • -Quality of green pieces is in question
  • -Squid launcher a no-go

The verdict? Find Ehlek some where at an affordable price, and buy him. While he may have his faults (and what Barraki, or Bionicle set for that matter, doesn't?), Ehlek has got to be one of the best Barraki you can buy. Find him, buy him, and have fun; just watch out for those awesome spines of his ;)

author: tkettle9719
title: Anorexic Bionicle?
review:
I got this set on the Easter of 2007 from the bunny himself, and find this set to be all right, but it is greatly flawed when compared to other Bionicle sets, especially other Barraki.

Pros

  • The spikes have a sense of villainy in them.
  • The pincers on Ehlek are also a nice addition to this otherwise bland set.

Cons

  • There is absolutely no armor on this guy, and it shows around the torso, arms, and legs...a lot. This guy needs to take my diet of fried chicken and salad (dressing).
  • Lego got bored with weapons, and thus decided to include two of those blade-things, as well as a dysfunctional squid launcher.

This set is all right for younger kids, but is disappointing for me, a hardcore fan of Bionicle. If you want it, get it, but have either a lot of armor or a really small price offered to you.
